results.headline: Review: Brian De Palma Says He Is Hitchcock’s True Heir
results.summary_short: In the documentary “De Palma,” Mr. De Palma explores his muse, and the juxtaposition of images from both of their works goes beyond glib shorthand.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of De Palma

results.headline: Review: ‘Genius’ Puts Max Perkins and Thomas Wolfe in a Literary Bromance
results.summary_short: Michael Grandage’s 1930s-era biopic is nostalgia for a supposed golden age of masculine artistic potency.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Genius

results.headline: Review: ‘Careful What You Wish For,’ Starring Nick Jonas as a Naïve Teenage Lover
results.summary_short: Elizabeth Allen’s film casts Mr. Jonas as a boy who takes up with the beautiful woman next door in a summer idyll that proves anything but.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Careful What You Wish For

results.headline: Review: ‘Germans & Jews,’ a New Generation Continues a Difficult Conversation
results.summary_short: In Janina Quint’s documentary, a group of Jewish and non-Jewish Germans, most of them born after World War II, reckon with the past.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Germans & Jews

results.headline: Review: ‘Puerto Ricans in Paris’ Combines Comedy and Crime
results.summary_short: Two New York police officers get a break from their home lives when they are asked to help stop a counterfeiter in France.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Puerto Ricans in Paris

results.headline: Review: Taking the Long Way Home in ‘Last Cab to Darwin’
results.summary_short: A dying man who works as a cabby longs to leave the world on his own terms, so he turns the wheel toward eternity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Last Cab to Darwin

results.headline: Review: ‘Now You See Me 2’ Illusionists Are Out to Save the World
results.summary_short: The sleight-of-hand the Four Horsemen must pull off in this cartoonish movie, directed by Jon M. Chu, would protect everyone’s computers.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Now You See Me 2

results.headline: Review: In ‘Be Somebody,’ a Teenage Idol Goes AWOL With an Ordinary Girl
results.summary_short: Matthew Espinosa plays a pop star who has had enough with his tour handlers and sees how the other folks live.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Be Somebody

results.headline: Review: ‘The Music of Strangers,’ on Yo-Yo Ma and the Silk Road Ensemble
results.summary_short: Morgan Neville’s documentary follows the ensemble and discusses the relevance of music in a violent world. Lovely to watch, it’s even more beautiful to hear.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Music of Strangers

results.headline: Review: In ‘Therapy for a Vampire,’ the Count Really Wants to Change
results.summary_short: Sigmund Freud takes a vampire as a patient in this comedy written and directed by David Ruehm.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Therapy for a Vampire

results.headline: Review: In ‘Tikkun,’ a Hasidic Student’s Visions Merge With Metaphor
results.summary_short: This feature from the Israeli director Avishai Sivan employs fanciful imagery in dark but often funny ways, without abandoning empathy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tikkun

results.headline: Review: ‘Diary of a Chambermaid’ Stars Léa Seydoux as an Abused Maid
results.summary_short: Taking a period role memorably played by Paulette Goddard and Jeanne Moreau, Ms. Seydoux evokes the mutual loathing of the haves and have-nots.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Diary of a Chambermaid

results.headline: Review: In ‘Warcraft,’ Orcs of a Different Domain, Fighting With Heart
results.summary_short: Directed by Duncan Jones, this cinematic extension of the brand that began as a video game features invading orcs, embattled humans and much pummeling.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Warcraft

results.headline: Review: ‘’Til Madness Do Us Part’ Finds Hell and Humanity
results.summary_short: Wang Bing’s documentary about a mental hospital in China is overlong but sporadically extraordinary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 'Til Madness Do Us Part

results.headline: Review: ‘From Afar,’ a Tale of Desire and Repression in Venezuela
results.summary_short: A middle-aged gay man who lures young men from the streets develops an unlikely friendship with a tough, handsome teenager.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of From Afar

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Fits,’ a Graceful Tale of a Girl Who Follows Her Own Beat
results.summary_short: This debut feature from Anna Rose Holmer centers on an 11-year-old tomboy who trains as a boxer only to discover an interest in joining an all-female dance team.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Fits

results.headline: Review: ‘Art Bastard’ Depicts Robert Cenedella, a Rebel Artist
results.summary_short: This documentary zeros in on a painter who defied art-world conventions with teeming satirical paintings.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Art Bastard

results.headline: Review: ‘Time to Choose’ Extols Renewable Energy to Combat Global Warming
results.summary_short: Charles Ferguson’s documentary is a sobering polemic about climate change that balances predictions of planetary doom with a survey of innovations in energy technology.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Time to Choose

results.headline: Review: ‘The Final Master,’ a Martial Arts Story of Transitions
results.summary_short: A kung fu master seeks a wife and a place to teach in Tianjin, and finds what he needs, if not what he was looking for.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Final Master

results.headline: Review: ‘The Thoughts That Once We Had,’ a Cinematic Flight
results.summary_short: A montage of film clips that takes us on a wild ride through cinematic history.
results.display_title: The Thoughts That Once We Had
